propel.core.tracing

Class Tracer<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • propel.core.tracing.Tracer<T>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.reflect.InvocationHandler

    public class Tracer<T>
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.reflect.InvocationHandler
    Class allowing for method call tracing. Note: The generic type parameter T should be an interface that the object you are proxying implements.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Tracer(java.lang.Class<?> clazz)
      Initialises with a class (of which the simple name is used as logger name) and a default trace message generator
      Tracer(java.lang.Class<?> clazz, ITraceMessageGenerator generator)
      Initialises with a class (of which the simple name is used as logger name)
      Tracer(Logger logger)
      Initialises with a logger and a default trace message generator
      Tracer(Logger logger, ITraceMessageGenerator generator)
      Initialises with a logger

    • Method Detail

      • proxy

        public T proxy(T objToProxy)
        Proxies the given object's public methods. Should only be used to proxy one run-time object. Note that the object must implement some interface(s), which you can use when creating this tracer. It will be used to cast the result to an interface.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - An argument is null
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - This method has already been called

      • invoke

        public java.lang.Object invoke(java.lang.Object proxy,
                      java.lang.reflect.Method method,
                      java.lang.Object[] args)
                        throws java.lang.Throwable
        Should not be used by client code. Implicitly invoked when method calls are made on the proxied object. Responsible for performing tracing using specified log level.
        Specified by:
        invoke in interface java.lang.reflect.InvocationHandler
        Throws:
        java.lang.Throwable
